One of my favorites out of the Penhaligon line.  It is too bad that out of all of the toiletries Quercus has to offer, they do not include a shaving cream or balm.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="283868"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=283868#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent263031" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc263031" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kxnaiades"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/190841"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.190841.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kxnaiades" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Journey-Woman-25252.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25252.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Journey Woman"title="Journey Woman"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma263031ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd263031" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/190841">kxnaiades</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-06-26">06/26/12 21:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this. love it love it so much I have the soap and body lotion. I honestly don't care that I'm wearing a male cologne, to me it's unisex not masculine. I love the spontaneous, impulsive, quirky, impish character i become once this brings me to life( anyone who reads Jilly Cooper novels- Tabitha Campbell Black wore this). It's fresh and zesty citrus all over, a clean and lively scent, not to be mixed up with detergent or soapy smells by all the "cleanliness" descriptions going on. My only wish is that it lasted longer :( but it helps with layering on top of the body lotion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="263031"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=263031#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent194634" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc194634" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="neptune1121"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/55103"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.55103.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="neptune1121" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zara/Tie-Or-Dye-65919.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65919.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tie Or Dye"title="Tie Or Dye"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma194634ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd194634" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/55103">neptune1121</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-11-02">11/02/11 23:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I adore Penhaligon's collection, and I collect some. The first impression for me was Quercus is similar like... you know what. So, I never try it again, or even "put" it on my collection list.<br />
However, after a few months since that first impression, I try again Quercus. This time, I sprayed it in wrist. I sniff it all day, and I found a gap between Quercus and "that one"... Like what they said before me, Quercus is more "calm", or if I can say more "elegant".  Now, I have a dilemma. Should I have it, or leave it...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="194634"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=194634#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent112951" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc112951" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AveParfum"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.35807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AveParfum" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Alba-6967.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6967.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alba"title="Alba"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma112951ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd112951" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807">AveParfum</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-11-28">11/28/10 00:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's says it's unisex.  When I stayed at the Fairmont, all of their little toiletries were Quercus.  It's fresh &amp; clean with a soft woodsy base.  The citrus is not overwhelming in any way (I can be sensitive to citrus).  It was hard to find in the US, but I was very excited when I stumbled upon a boutique that sold Penhaligon's.  I bought a large bottle, which was the most I'd ever spent on perfume in my life up until that point.<br />
<br />
So imagine how annoyed I was when my friend commented that I smelled like CK1.  To be honest, CK1 never even crossed my mind, and I'm very familiar with it.  Still, I have not been able to wear it since then.  My dad loves it.  He says it's "very pretty."  He is not a fan of those typical masculine colognes.  I'm happy to let him borrow it, and I don't think of CK1 when he wears it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="112951"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=112951#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent104937" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc104937" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dick Turpin Esq"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14862"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.14862.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dick Turpin Esq" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cartier/Declaration-307.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.307.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Declaration"title="Declaration"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma104937ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd104937" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14862">Dick Turpin Esq</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-10-09">10/09/10 16:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To my nose, the notes on this are slightly misleading and a tad simplistic. What I detect is quite contrary and no doubt what Mr Penhaligon was intending (actually the man's been dead over a hundred years).<br />
<br />
The opening to my mind is like the heady astringency of a freshly opened foil packet of Smiths Crisps (potato chips)  the Salt n Vinegar flavour that one can only reliably find in downmarket British inner city  working-class pubs.<br />
<br />
This salt n vinegar note is over almost as quickly as a packet of Smiths Crisps by a hungry drunk who has skipped dinner and is desperate to eat some greasy snacks as his sixth pint of lager swills about his empty stomach. <br />
<br />
It is overtaken by furniture polish and brasso that enhances the symphony of British Pub notes. One can almost detect the acrid petroleum based brasso and reek of furniture polish spray which is balanced by the subdued pong of old damp pub carpet that has been infused with spilt beer and cigarette smoke from the 1980s and trodden in grit and dust that has been traipsed in by patrons gagging for a pint straight off the building site with little hopes of greater aspirations.<br />
<br />
The dry down is a muted petroleum smudge with a hint of an ink stain and an old damp kitchen cloth that needs to be laundered or thrown away. Overall a perfect homage to a dank British Pub in the 1980s.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="104937"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=104937#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent101899" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc101899" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kterhark"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/12596"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.12596.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kterhark" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Agua-de-Sevilla/Agua-de-Naranjos-16229.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16229.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Agua de Naranjos"title="Agua de Naranjos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma101899ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd101899" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/12596">Kterhark</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-09-22">09/22/10 17:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>What a breath of fresh air! I'm liking Quercus, but I do think it dips it foot further inside the man cave than i would like (i.e, i would prefer this on my SO rather than myself)<br />
<br />
I really can't think of anything negative to say about this.  Teh citrus opening is spot on (love it, actually), and the drydown is flawless.  I"m surprised it was created in 1999, it has a more 'mature' feeling to me, as if it were made at the turn of the century.<br />
<br />
thumbs up!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="101899"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=101899#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent101220" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc101220" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gypsy parfumista"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16449"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.16449.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gypsy parfumista" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/House-of-Matriarch/Fitnessence-31063.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31063.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fitnessence"title="Fitnessence"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma101220ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd101220" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16449">gypsy parfumista</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-09-18">09/18/10 06:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Quercus is Latin for oak, and brings to mind strong woody aromas, greens, leaves and an earthy rooted feel; masculine, yet beautiful and warm...strong enough to stand firm, but supple enough to sway with the Wind,Penhaligon hit the nail on the head with this one!<br />
<br />
Quercus begins with an utterly beautiful citrus melange that really shines. Not too much of any one particular citrus, but the best of all of them. The mint adds a fresh aromatic greeness to it without the menthol aftertaste or biting pungency. As it dries and begins to develop on the skin, it reveals a muguet and jasmine combo that is clean and not too floral, but still sexy and verdant. Cardamom adds its subtle aqueous spice to this and keeps it from getting too feminine, but guys have a softer side too,(they just don't show it as much!). The basenotes develop on me, but they are very understated: the galbanum whspers, as opposed to it's normally loud scent, and the woods are delicate but firm. The oakmoss is breezy and adds that chypre-ness to the overall feel and the amber-musk adds depth without too much 'stink' (I mean that in the classic and not derogatory meaning!)An extremely elegant scent that is very clean and light, with just enough prescence to linger, but not  overpower. Nice enough to be unisex, but probably would do better on a man.<br />
<br />
Sillage: decent<br />
Longevity: good<br />
Overall: 4.25/5<br />
<br />
I can see why many compare this to cK 1, but I find this scent to be far more elegant and refined than cK1 and would wear it more for special occasions as opposed to an everyday scent. cK1 is great, don't get me wrong; it's just that Penhaligon scents are (besides much more expensive) more natural smelling and quite a bit better constructed on the whole. I am very pleased with my first samplings from this house and see a bleak bank balance in my future...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="101220"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=101220#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent96140" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc96140" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sherapop"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17027"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.17027.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sherapop" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chanel-No-5-L-Eau-38543.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38543.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"title="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma96140ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd96140" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17027">sherapop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-08-19">08/19/10 17:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon QUERCUS is a uniquely structured fragrance. It opens very aromatically, with lots of bright citrus and vibrant basil. Next it settles into a greenish chypre peppered with lily of the valley. Incredibly, however, the drydown becomes aromatic once again: cardamom mingles with a woody-musk base, along with a touch of citrus oil. <br />
<br />
I like this composition a lot and don't think that it belongs only to men. QUERCUS seems a fine summertime scent for anyone looking for a very natural-feeling citrus aromatic floral green chypre!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="96140"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=96140#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent32896" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc32896" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Darius HIldenbrandt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10517"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.10517.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Darius HIldenbrandt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ferrari/Leather-Essence-18901.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18901.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Leather Essence"title="Leather Essence"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma32896ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd32896" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10517">Darius HIldenbrandt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-05-13">05/13/09 04:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>good and enough expensive cologne, but not the best(for me). very beautiful and traditional shape of the bottle</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="32896"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=32896#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent6217" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc6217" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sophywt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1163"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1163.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sophywt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Spicebomb-13857.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13857.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Spicebomb"title="Spicebomb"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma6217ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd6217" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1163">sophywt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2008-09-02">09/02/08 09:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lots of People compare this one with CK one. They did smell alike, but they present totally different characters. One is symbol of Pop culture, the other stands for, let say, a modesty tradition.<br />
<br />
Generally speaking, CKone presents notes in a showy way: sharp citrus, loud and spicy floral notes(jasmine with muguet)... but Quercus always smells much more softer and peaceful, the same citrus and floral seem to be tamed. <br />
<br />
My impression: CKone is a piece of glitter glass, shiny and colorful. Quercus is a piece of soft velvet shimmering under the moonlight.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="6217"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=6217#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1252420" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1252420" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MaquiLab"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254834"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1254834.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MaquiLab" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1252420ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1252420" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254834">MaquiLab</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-11-24">11/24/20 02:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not your regular fresh scent, that's for sure! Opens up crisp and bright like a summer morning. The next thing you know is that you've just opened the closet where you keep the clean linen. Next up is the dreamy mix of moss and amber. Quercus is basically what I'd imagine a stay in a fine hotel somewhere in the UK is like - clean bedsheets, fine toiletries and, as you open the door to the balcony in the morning, a whiff of the park's greenery.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="1252420"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=1252420#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent96140" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc96140" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sherapop"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17027"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.17027.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sherapop" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chanel-No-5-L-Eau-38543.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38543.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"title="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma96140ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd96140" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17027">sherapop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-08-19">08/19/10 17:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon QUERCUS is a uniquely structured fragrance. It opens very aromatically, with lots of bright citrus and vibrant basil. Next it settles into a greenish chypre peppered with lily of the valley. Incredibly, however, the drydown becomes aromatic once again: cardamom mingles with a woody-musk base, along with a touch of citrus oil. <br />
<br />
I like this composition a lot and don't think that it belongs only to men. QUERCUS seems a fine summertime scent for anyone looking for a very natural-feeling citrus aromatic floral green chypre!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="96140"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=96140#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent807027" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc807027" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vinyl_junky"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1054736"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vinyl_junky" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Geo-F-Trumper/GFT-5004.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5004.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="GFT"title="GFT"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma807027ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd807027" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1054736">vinyl_junky</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-03-28">03/28/17 20:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As most reviews here have noted, this smells similar to CK One, with less longevity and sillage. <br />
<br />
I concur, but in my opinion Quercus is a more refined fragrance. CK One is loud - a tart citrus, in-your-face florals. Quercus is more restrained and well-rounded. You have the same citrus and floral notes, but they seem more natural and blend together better. <br />
<br />
If CK One was your signature scent in high school, Quercus is what you would be wearing to the office as an adult.<br />
<br />
Overall, a pleasant scent, I just wish longevity was better (I get around 2 hours).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="807027"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=807027#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent533216" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc533216" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ChrisInBrooklyn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/290096"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.290096.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ChrisInBrooklyn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dana/Tabu-1104.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1104.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tabu"title="Tabu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma533216ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd533216" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/290096">ChrisInBrooklyn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-10-18">10/18/14 18:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a small body lotion sample, and I *knew* it smelled so familiar, but I couldn't quite place it. And yes, It is verrry similar to CK One! It may actually be a bit more subtle, and significantly less synthetic. Ultimately I think it's a more aromatic and refined identical twin... I think CK One is pretty obnoxious, but don't mind Quercus at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="533216"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=533216#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent112951" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc112951" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AveParfum"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.35807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AveParfum" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Alba-6967.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6967.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alba"title="Alba"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma112951ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd112951" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807">AveParfum</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-11-28">11/28/10 00:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's says it's unisex.  When I stayed at the Fairmont, all of their little toiletries were Quercus.  It's fresh &amp; clean with a soft woodsy base.  The citrus is not overwhelming in any way (I can be sensitive to citrus).  It was hard to find in the US, but I was very excited when I stumbled upon a boutique that sold Penhaligon's.  I bought a large bottle, which was the most I'd ever spent on perfume in my life up until that point.<br />
<br />
So imagine how annoyed I was when my friend commented that I smelled like CK1.  To be honest, CK1 never even crossed my mind, and I'm very familiar with it.  Still, I have not been able to wear it since then.  My dad loves it.  He says it's "very pretty."  He is not a fan of those typical masculine colognes.  I'm happy to let him borrow it, and I don't think of CK1 when he wears it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="112951"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=112951#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="4563" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>

    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1314247" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tonkatsu335"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254643"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1254643.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tonkatsu335" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Linda-Landenberg/A-Trembling-Rose-47015.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47015.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="A Trembling Rose"title="A Trembling Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1314247ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1314247" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254643">tonkatsu335</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-26">03/26/21 04:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is unisex, but I think the cardamom makes it more masculine.<br />
If you don't like the smell that men's perfumes tend to have, this may not be for you.<br />
<br />
I think the scent is strong for a cologne.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="1314247"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=1314247#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent930299" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc930299" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="adrienn99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27130"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.27130.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="adrienn99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Al-Haramain-Perfumes/Belle-Rouge-63932.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63932.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Belle Rouge"title="Belle Rouge"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma930299ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd930299" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27130">adrienn99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-04-07">04/07/18 03:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>a hit and miss for me...I think it was an attempt to offer something different within the genre but eventually I find it too flat, lacking character and depth.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="930299"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=930299#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent511994" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc511994" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Redbeard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.537021.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Redbeard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma511994ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd511994" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021">Redbeard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-09">08/09/14 08:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The top is a lot like that of CK One, which in my opinion is pleasant, but with a bit more believable fruitiness. Unfortunately, as it gets sweeter, the fruit begins to overripen a bit. The sweetness surpasses CK One, or the fruity middle of Halston Unbound, but the fruit isn't as artificial as in Eternity. Quercus also has a bit less of CK One's assy faux leather base, which I begin to dislike after a while, but it's still enough for me to notice it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="511994"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=511994#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1422658" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1422658" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sabahstan3000"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1396771"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1396771.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sabahstan3000" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Philosophy/Pure-Grace-4854.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4854.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pure Grace"title="Pure Grace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1422658ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1422658" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1396771">sabahstan3000</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-05">10/05/21 09:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Had this recommended to me in their store, the initial sniff (through a mask, mind you) was cleaning-product fresh, which I enjoyed, but when I got a sample in the mail it was 100% too cologne-y for me. It's marketed for women and men, but it's a male cologne in my opinion. Far too musky and aftershave-y, which ruined any of the freshness I bought it for.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="1422658"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=1422658#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1630738" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1630738" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maryteresatu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1473570"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="maryteresatu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Eau-des-Merveilles-9.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau des Merveilles"title="Eau des Merveilles"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1630738ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1630738" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1473570">maryteresatu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-24">08/24/22 20:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wore this during hot summer. For a woman who live in Taiwan like me, its too manly and too western smell. This fragrance gives me a sense of a play boy</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4563"comment_id="1630738"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Quercus-4563.html?ccid=1630738#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="4563" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>

              tabindex="1" title=" @(oh) well, well, well good grief lmao">by
            <em>masonreed</em> <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/s.2038572.jpg"

    </div>
    <div class="latest-list flex-container">

                        <span class="ztworowseclipse"> Fragrance Innovation Summit: Focus on the Perfumery of Today and Tomorrow</span>
        </a>
        <span class="avatar-tip" data-tooltip aria-haspopup="true" data-show-on="medium" data-disable-hover="false"
              tabindex="1" title="Nothing new here, just different slants on technologies that have been around for years. <script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
